website_summaries.verdict: This is an easy-to-use, affordable trackball mouse for those who prefer a central location for their trackball.
pros: The optical sensor makes this trackball mouse very accurate
Trackball is lightweight and easy to move
The design makes it ideal for right and left-handed users
cons: This mouse does not include a scroll wheel, which many buyers noted that they missed

website_summaries.verdict: Incorporating sleek design and durability, the mouse is perfect for both left- and right-handers; treat it right, and it will operate flawlessly for many years.
pros: Comfortable enough to use for long periods of time – whether working or gaming – this mouse exhibits excellent functionality in small spaces and on nearly any surface
Perfect for anyone afflicted with arthritis or carpal tunnel syndrome and looking for an inexpensive solution
cons: Some users wish it were wireless
the track ball does have to be cleaned on occasion to keep it moving smoothly

customer_reviews.title: Very Ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these, one for each hand, and it takes some getting used to, but it is worth it. It's easy to abuse these and use these and scroll with one finger like a regular mouse, but if you use them with proper form and distribute the rolling motion of the ball evenly with all of your hand, instead of just one finger like a regular mouse scroll wheel, then it will alleviate hand/wrist pain. That's also why I have one for each hand to distribute that scrolling, which helps when I'm on a computer 8 hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Good physical product, but software not being maintained by Logitech
customer_reviews.text: The trackball is compact, comfortable, well designed and has excellent mechanical action. It is also very reasonably priced. However Logitech stopped supporting the software years ago. The scroll function for example, which is a critical productivity component of using this kind of device has not worked in most applications since windows seven. Now your only option is to hack some third party scroll option, but we have not found any that work consistently. Kensington, for example, has outstanding software support for their products. Logitech seems to have given up on theirs totally.
customer_reviews.author: coppersleeve

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Trackman Marble Mouse, Four-Button, Programmable, Dark Gray (New) BEST for PC gaming
customer_reviews.text: i have been using a Logitech Marble mouse for as long as i have been gaming, possibly since the days of the old Doom, i cannot recall for certain, but it has the speed and flexibility of changing views and going 360 without the awkwardness of a regular mouse. if you are into PC gaming, try it and see the difference. it lasts for years with no problems. Delivery was very fast, the packaging was undamaged, and most of all the price was the best i have found. i certainly appreciate LLYtech's service and recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: janet mills

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: THIS TRACKMAN MARBLE MOUSE ONLY WORKED ABOUT 3 MONTHS; COMPUTER DOES NOT "RECOGNIZE" IT
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Trackman Marble Mouse for around 10 years; I have always been pleased with it; I do not know why anyone would not like them; my old one simply was dropped too many times & finally wore out; VERY PLEASED WITH THE NEW ONE!! Thanks! -----SAD UPDATE: AS OF AROUND OCTOBER 1ST, THIS TRACKBALL MOUSE STOPPED WORKING... IT WAS NOT DROPPED ANY; MY HP ELITEBOOK LAPTOP, WITH WINDOWS 10 INSTALLED, WILL NO LONGER EVEN RECOGNIZE THIS MOUSE, EXCEPT TO GIVE A NOTE THAT "THE LAST USB DEVICE.... MALFUNCTIONED AND.... WINDOWS DOES NOT RECOGNIZE IT....... BUT I WILL TRY ANOTHER ONE, AS I HAVE HAD BETTER LUCK WITH THEM IN THE PAST....... Rick
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone downhill...
customer_reviews.text: The first of these mice that I ordered worked well from December of 2011 to August of 2019, then it started seizing up, disconnecting from the computer and generally acting crazy. I had been happy with it for 8 years, so I ordered another one. Here it is, not a full year later and that one is acting just like the first one did after 8 years. I have ordered a different type of mouse and will not purchase this type again.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Amazon delivers an inferior model of the Trackman
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason (bait & switch, sloppy web page management, ???), Amazon advertises a great Trackman Marble (model number 910-000806 shown in the left two photos) but actually delivers an inferior model number 810-000767 (shown in the right two photos). The 810 seems to work OK, but after only six weeks of use, it already has click issues similar to after 15 years of use with the better model I had. To increase the time before this inferior model fails completely (by reducing the number of clicks), I have changed my computer software to single click instead of double click. I also use my laptop track pad instead of the Trackman Marble when making multiple clicks in a close location.
customer_reviews.author: Jim 1

customer_reviews.title: NO scroll whell
customer_reviews.text: I've been a huge fan of cordless optical trackman which seems to be discontinued. I bought this mouse for work not realizing that it does NOT have a scroll wheel. What a waste of money! On a mac, you can download their driver and map those little button for scrolling up and down, but their acceleration setting is almost unusable; too slow or too fast - there's no middle ground.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Fluid

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Scroll in Windows 10 64-bit OS
customer_reviews.text: I've used Logitech Trackman in the past and was always pleased with them. However, the design of this mouse makes it difficult to use the small and poorly placed 3rd and 4th programable keys. Also, the Logitech SetPoint software for this mouse do not allow you to scroll, which for me is essential. It lets me assign scroll functions to keys 3 or 4, but then does nothing when you press those keys. You should get a scroll cursor on the screen, and then scroll using the mouse, but it doesn't work. I'm using Windows 10 64-bit operating system. Don't waste your money on this ... get a mouse that has a physical scroll feature.
customer_reviews.author: Nebraska Dude

customer_reviews.title: No scroll capability means no way for me
customer_reviews.text: I guess I should have read the reviews more carefully, but I didn't even think about a modern device not having a scroll capability. My ancient Logitech Optical Track Man, which I loved, finally died and this looked like a good replacement. It looks like they changed to this central ball so they would only have to make one for both left and right handers, but gave up the scroll wheel in the process. I'm deeply disappointed and this is basically useless for me, but I've already thrown away the packaging. Now to search for another option that meets 21st century requirements.
customer_reviews.author: R. Earl

customer_reviews.title: If you haven't tried one I highly recommend doing so
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for years. I play a lot of games which require extreme use of the left mouse button. This has been the point of failure on each of them. The button never really fails, it just becomes unreliable which can be the kiss of death when gaming.My son plays several first person shooters and sword/dueling games.He is often accused of cheating because he can turn and attack so quickly. Still these last me about five years each. For the price and convenience I plan to keep using these. If you haven't tried one I highly recommend doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Tazio57

customer_reviews.title: Basic, high quality wired Logitech trackball. ⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.text: I have long been a fan of trackballs since way back when. I find them easier to use and more comfortable. I have several Logitech trackballs, so when I needed one to use with my laptop while working remotely, this was the easy choice. I had to get one that was USB wired to work with my secure laptop that will not allow Bluetooth accessories. Not many options, but this was a no brainer for me. Came quickly, installed quickly and works like a charm. Doesn’t have some of the bells and whistles that my other trackballs have, but at this price, what do you expect. Basic, quality product from Logitech that you won’t be disappointed with. 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: K. F. Steele

customer_reviews.title: May want to change pointer speed.
customer_reviews.text: The Logictech mouse installed to both Windows platform and my Linux Mint computer as soon as was plugged in. Skill of using the ball comes quick, however pointer speed way to slow out of the box. Speed it up in computer mouse settings! One of the cons I've seen from others is no scroll wheel. The way I turn the ball into a scrolling wheel is quickly move the mouse pointer all the way to the right off screen, but over the part of the scroll bar that moves while doing so, then just left click and start scrolling with your ball. If only it had a little scroll wheel behind the ball so you wouldn't have to do that.
customer_reviews.author: tellfile

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Carpal Tunnel Syndrome, Arthritis, and Fibromyalgia
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. I go through a few per year because I'm clumsy and drop them frequently. But they are actually fairly sturdy and hold up well to my constant abuse. I love how the ergonomic design prevents me from making that C-shape with my hand that is necessary for using a traditional mouse. This doesn't aggravate my Carpal Tunnel Syndrome, Arthritis, and Fibromyalgia symptoms. It's very smooth to use, with fluid-feeling movement, and it doesn't take long at all to train one's self to use this style of mouse. I also love how I can program all 4 buttons for specialized tasks if I want.
customer_reviews.author: Gioia

customer_reviews.title: These things are beasts! (In a good way.)
customer_reviews.text: I only bought this as a replacement for my old one. Same model. Last one lasted over 8 years as my garage PC's pointing device. It survived freezing cold temps and blazing hot temps (Non-insulated garage) It put up with my grease covered hands as I watched youtube videos while working on cars. It was dropped, knocked around, and generally abused for years. It just died yesterday. (Only the buttons work, it stopped detecting motion, even after a complete cleaning.) So, I ordered another, and expect this one to last me another 8+ years of hard abuse.
customer_reviews.author: C.Carver

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Tackball
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this particular mouse for over 10 years and have purchased quite a few in that time... Some people look at it and don't understand how anybody can use something so weird... lol.. Once you go Trackball, you don't go back... The nice thing is, it has no effect on operating other mice or touch pads... Ya know how sometimes using a differently laid out keyboard can totally mess ya up?... not so with this mouse... Also they work in tight spaces and no need for a mouse pad... I have tried other trackballs and they don't work nearly as well as these old stand-by Logitechs! THANKS!
customer_reviews.author: Jahson

customer_reviews.title: This is how ergonomics should be done!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this mouse. Working primarily from home, this mouse allows me to work on a laptop pad and not run out of space with a traditional mouse. It's perfect for that AND there's still more.......it also allows me to maintain a more natural hand position that prevents fatigue or carpel tunnel (sp.) in the wrist. I'm not sure this would be ideal for the gamer as the ball can be harder to move around a game but I'm also not a gamer so I could be way off base. I've been using these types of mice for years and this Logitech brand is my number one choice.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse with one flaw
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this mouse for over 10 years. The mouse itself is fantastic but at this point I have like 5 or 6 of them. The problem is that one of the clicks, either left or right gets messed up and any time you click it, it double clicks. I have no idea how to fix it so I just keep buying more. I am currently using 2 for my regular computer and one for my work computer. So far the new ones with the "logi" writing are surviving better than the one with the full logitech written on it. If the clickers didn't wear out it would be a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Near mouse-masterpiece.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I've had one of them for many years and they just don't quit in my experience. Easy to clean easy to maintain. If they spruced up the button feel and density a bit it would be a masterpiece of mouse hardware. I play mostly computer games (FPS genre) with them. takes a bit of getting used to. But technically you can wing that mouseball around as fast as it can spin. Accuracy and practice being a different subject. This is a very friendly mouse. Not a direction-misbehavior failing mat-rat of the good old days. (Though there were good and bad of those too.) This is a good, good, mouse at a very decent, pricepoint.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrell

customer_reviews.title: No Scroll Function
customer_reviews.text: After two months and about a dozen emails with Logitech which contained constant requests for information which I provided over and over, I finally found someone that seemed to know what they were doing. They provided a link to software for the mouse, which provided a SKIP function, not scroll. By pressing the small button on the left and right, the screen will skip forward or back. The software allowed me to set the amount of skip that remains fixed until the setting for amount and speed is changed. It should be noted this mouse does not appear on the Logitech web site.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: this is the 7th (seventh) mouse I have ordered - exactly the same. I love the mouse, but the last one I bought was in October 2018 and I already have to replace it. It needs a rubber reinforcement where the wire goes into the mouse because it always breaks connection there. I've only had it 9 months this time. I'm tired of replacing it every few months!!! Wake up LOGITECH!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Carol Hays

customer_reviews.title: It's all I use now
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouse. I've owned several and recently bought one for my husband also, at his request after trying mine. They hold up well and make it easy to sit back in your chair (I keep mine in my lap) instead of being tied to a mouse pad. I suppose bluetooth would work just as well, but this is great for a wired mouse. Logitech did good with this.
customer_reviews.author: Robin U

customer_reviews.title: Switched  to this years ago due to carpal tunnel symptoms
customer_reviews.text: I was starting to get carpal tunnel symptoms so I ditched the mouse for day to day work and moved to this trackball. That was at least 7 or 8 years ago and I've stuck with this device ever since. It's awesome. Easy to clean, holds up for years and can be easily switched between hands. You can change your finger and hand movements as well to ease pressure on your wrists. I have two of these and just ordered a third to replace one of them that's finally showing it's age.
customer_reviews.author: Deamis

customer_reviews.title: Trackball works well but scrolling function does not
customer_reviews.text: I prefer a trackball over having to move a mouse around to navigate the screen and this one works great. But this really needs a scrolling wheel because scrolling is unreliable. This has the functionality to assign a scrolling function to one of the buttons. Unfortunately, that function does not work on all applications. This means that you have to click on a scrolling bar to move up and down - which is difficult because most scrolling bars are semi-hidden in many applications.
customer_reviews.author: gmo

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN A MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: i've been using a trackball since the late 90's. it's the only way to go. i don't have to chase my curser all over the desktop, it keeps me from "hand fatigue" while cruising the internet. i think the last one i bought lasted around 20 years. it took me all of about 4 seconds to get used to in the 90's, & i've never looked back. i cannot function w/o this product. it's become a necessity -- like a microwave oven. the logitech is really a very well made trackball.
customer_reviews.author: mec

customer_reviews.title: Go-to Trackball
customer_reviews.text: This has been my go-to trackball for years. I use my left hand for the mouse and this is one of the few that can be used with either hand. I love that I can choose the function of the two extra buttons. I have them set for cut and paste which I find very handy. The reason I use my left hand is to spread out the work between my dominant right hand and my left hand. I have a family history of carpel-tunnel but using this trackball, my wrists feel fine.
customer_reviews.author: MzLiberty

customer_reviews.title: A great entry level budget Trackball
customer_reviews.text: This is a good Trackball for those adjusting to them. It works well and features a medium sized ball for more control than some of the thumb operated models. It is responsive and built well, and the forward and back buttons are nice features. While I prefer the Logitech M570 for ergonomics and the Kensington Expert for overall size and features, the marble is good for basic operations. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to try an ambidextrous trackball.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Venditti

customer_reviews.title: Loyal user for almost 10 years!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this model of trackball for years. They are durable, and the only reason I ever replace them is because the ball itself ends up getting nicked up by a move/accident/whatever and then it sticks. I am a really picky person, so I end up replacing the mouse within a few days when this happens. I keep with this particular model because I really don't like the trackballs that put the ball next to your thumb. That style makes my carpal tunnel issues flare up almost instantly. The only thing that would make this better is if it had a scroll wheel. I use this keyboard to get around that issue:
customer_reviews.author: Tanara Petrova

customer_reviews.title: Used one of these for years
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this mouse for years now, and highly recommend it. It's comfortable. It's quick. Of course anything will eventually wear out, and I'm very abusive on my equipment, so I think this is the third one I have bought in the last 10 years or so, but I would definitely call it durable. This one is pretty basic, so if you've never used a trackball type mouse, it is easy to get used to. Give yourself a day or two to get used to the operation, and you won't go back to an old-fashioned mouse again.
customer_reviews.author: Moxie Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder replacement and still have to use computer A LOT
customer_reviews.text: Logitech is a great brand, I buy wireless keyboards, mice, webcams, etc. I wanted a wireless trackball but could not find one - so I got this one. Works great. Do not have to move my arm or hand all over the place and I just focus on using the left hand on keyboard. For now. Only gripe is that some of my apps (e.g., Outlook) does not seem to work with the trackball in scroll mode - cannot find any preference or setting to make it happen. So I am stuck with using page down key and left hand, not ideal. My recovery is progressing nicely so this is temporary.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfspecter

customer_reviews.title: excellent ergonomically
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for 25 years. Inexpensive and perfect for my needs. The only issue is that the microswitches for the click buttons have a short life. In time, you get double clicks, non clicks, and inability to drag and drop. Then you have to either disassemble the device and replace the switches, or replace the trackball, which I've done twice rather than try a much more expensive trackball, which I might not like as much.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but doesn't have an actual scrolling mechanism
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Trackman Marble to compare it with my Logitech M570. I know the Trackman Marble is a previous model but I was curious about the desing and its ergonomics. The Trackman Marble is comfortable overall but lacks a scrolling mechanism, which in my case is a deal breaker. You can set up a key to start the scrolling mode, then the movement of the cursor will initiate the scrolling, but it wasn't good enough for me. I used it at a daily basis for over two weeks to give it a change but after that it ended up in a drawer with the other devices I've tried so far. I'm sticking to the Logitech M570.
customer_reviews.author: Ahoy A.

customer_reviews.title: Mac users beware
customer_reviews.text: I stopped using Logitech products on Macs 25 years ago. Great hardware, horrible software. Tried again. Nice trackball again, Logitech Software is still a disaster. After 6 hours of trying to get the Logitech software to see the device I gave up and returned the product. There are other utilities that will control the mouse but, at this point, I'm willing to pay the Apple tax and get another Magic Mouse. Like the man said, "it just works".
customer_reviews.author: RaytoTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one that I've purchased.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Logitech trackman marble trackball mouse that I've purchased. Actually, I have other Logitech trackballs too. This model can take a beating. The first one is still functional, but the finish is finally wearing off of it, causing it to get a bit hard to roll. It's probably 10 years old. I work in clay all day, so clay is constantly on my hands. This mouse is easy to clean and takes corrosion and wear quite well. I'd buy another in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Diane H Holycross

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Two deal breakers: 1: Ergonomics - wrist is in a bent position like any horizontal mouse. While it's not as bad since you aren't moving it around, it's still noticeable coming from a vertical mouse. 2: Scroll bar. This item lacks a scroll wheel, as do most trackball mice (why?). The mouse software provided by Logitech does allow the use scrolling keybinds, but it's awful; jerky and not smooth at all. Honorable Mention: Not wireless. For some reason, most trackballs are wire only. Strange, as they are not high-DPI gaming mice.
customer_reviews.author: Bankstercide

customer_reviews.title: Works well but feels REALLY chintzy
customer_reviews.text: I had a similarly shaped Logitech trackball about 10 years ago and loved it. I ordered this, thinking it would be the same. It is shaped the same but the material quality has dropped significantly. In all fairness, it works well, but for a piece of equipment that you rest your hand on pretty regularly, it provides a disappointing user experience - at least to me. If this were $6 I wouldn't care, but at this price point I was expecting better.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Lack of scroll wheel makes this useless in 2018.
customer_reviews.text: It's a high quality product. Works exactly as advertised. Only problem is: No scroll wheel. I didn't realize exactly how much of a problem this was until I didn't have it. Just about every app these days expects you to have a scroll wheel. Most modern apps don't even have scroll bars any more. Nowhere in the description does it ever claim that it does have a scroll wheel. This product comes exactly as advertised. It does what it says. And from what I can see, it does it well. But buyer beware: Be absolutely certain you can live without a scroll wheel before buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great for work at home people
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bc I work from home and needed some relief bc I have rheumatoid arthritis. I love the size. Using a trackball is much different than a regular mouse. Once you get used to it, it's awesome. Update: I do love this mouse and it helps with my RA but sometimes when I click on something it doesn't work and I have to keep clicking on whatever it is I'm trying to open. I have kept up with keeping it clean by removing the ball and cleaning the dust out and etc. That is my only complaint I have about it.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. K Trout

customer_reviews.title: Great to help with thumb pain.
customer_reviews.text: My wrist started hurting again and I bought this to help. I've used one at my last job and knew I needed to go back to one. This one works great. It's cheaper than the other one I had. Nice grip on the bottom. I've used one for a long time and this one is holding up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: AngieSewTherapy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly like the original that I bought YEARS ago!
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a replacement for my original track ball mouse for years! I could never find one. This particular track ball mouse is the most comfortable mouse I've ever used. Thinking they just didn't make this type anymore, I was overjoyed when hubs found this one! I work on my laptop while on my recliner, so this style mouse is exactly what I need. It sits on the arm of my recliner and doesn't slip due to the non stick strips on the bottom. If you use a mouse like this, you'll most likely be very happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Choosy Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite
customer_reviews.text: Using this mouse is like driving stick, people don't want to hop on my computer :P I have owned 3 of these ever since a friend got me to give it an honest try. Best ergonomic design and value I've got my hands on yet. But sometimes you may miss having a scroll wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good, but there are better options
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a good mouse. It feels very comfortable in the hand and the mouse button positions are very well thought out. The real problem is that there is no scroll wheel. In the modern age of computing, a scroll wheel is a must have for nearly every task. As such, if you do any web browsing, working in notepad or word, or really just about anything that might require a scroll wheel, I'd advise looking for alternate options.
customer_reviews.author: Magius96

customer_reviews.title: Great Ergo Features
customer_reviews.text: I used this mouse for for years at work. Then I retired and stared my own business. I noticed the current mouse I was using was not doing it for me. So, I was happy to find this mouse online. It is amazing! I know it's not for everyone and you have to learn how to use it. I'm about 5 feet with thin small palms but long, piano player fingers. And this mouse works hard to help me mouse and click in an ergonomically safe manner.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to my normal optic mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have an older tower pc I haven't used for about 2 years since I do most everything on a laptop. But I wanted to hook-up the tower to run some software on windows 7 that can't run on 10, but I had lost the original mouse. So I bought this track ball for that machine. I'd used one before some time back, but this model is improved from what I remember. I'm not a Gamer, so I can't give an opinion on it for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: R. G. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse because I was starting to have some wrist pain at work. After using it I no longer have wrist pain. I installed a driver that allows you to use the smaller buttons and the ball to scroll. This makes the mouse infinitely better and I’m not sure why it wasn’t included in the first place. I do have to clean it about twice a day or the rollerball becomes noticeably slow. This does not take more than a few seconds so it isn’t a big problem. Overall I am glad I got this mouse and I’ll continue to use it
customer_reviews.author: Jameson Schindler

customer_reviews.title: This trackball "mouse" is the best.
customer_reviews.text: I spend nearly 10 hours a day working at my computer. This is my third Logitech Trackball "mouse," and I wouldn't use anything else if I can help it. My 6 year old trackball started showing signs of wear, and wouldn't "track" well much of the time, so I happened to go to WalMart and looked for a replacement. They had a Logitech thing, with the trackball on the side. It looked as if it would be very awkward to use. It was also $40. and I decided to come home and see what Amazon might have. BINGO! Got one exactly like the last one, and almost $20. savings. Note to self... Look at Amazon FIRST from now on.
customer_reviews.author: MamaLiberty

customer_reviews.title: Ambidextrous Trackball
customer_reviews.text: I am left handed. In the world of trackballs, most are set up for right hander's only. This trackball is ambidextrous. I have used this model for many years but can no longer find them locally. Fortunately Amazon has them. They are ultra durable - my last trackball lasted over 15 years. We do use them for gaming and they work great! Since they are ambidextrous, they are extremely comfortable for either hand. Money well spent! I'd give them more than 5 stars if it were allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent alternative to traditional mouse
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as insurance against my current Trackman of the same type failing. I'm handicapped and can't operate a normal mouse due to lacking 9 fingers. This provides an excellent replacement for left hand use (can be used with either hand). I'm very happy with these. (I've owned several.) It is advertised as having four buttons, including two small buttons inset into the main trackball buttons. They're assigned to something, but given my handicap, I can't reliably make use of them. They seem less than useful as a feature.
customer_reviews.author: rasetsu

customer_reviews.title: This mouse gave me RSI in the thumb, so called "Gamers thumb"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse thinking I would be safe not to get RSI problems...because it stated it's an ergomomic design. Well now I seem to have gotten a gamers thumb problem from using it. In my opinion this mouse is not an ergonomic mouse....yes your wrist get's less tension, but you thumb has to really do a lot more work compared to the old skool mouse... I would not recommend this mouse, the thumb get overloaded very quick with all the clicking!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Durgaram

customer_reviews.title: Plugged it in and NOTHING!
customer_reviews.text: After having a Bluetooth wireless trackball die after six weeks, I decided to just get a wired one. Picked this one up and it arrived in two days. Opened it, plugged it into the USB port on the laptop and nothing happened. Tried checking settings to see if it was detected as a device. Nope. Nothing. I guess it's going back. Tried What a waste of time. Logitech used make good products.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse on the market for many years!
customer_reviews.text: Hope they keep making this oldie but good mouse! It's the perfect fit for my small hand. I have RSI so a trackball is the best. This mouse continues to keep my RSI at bay. I do wish they would make it wireless, but I'm still happy with this one. Logitech's other mice just aren't the right shape. This one is. REALLY hope they keep making it! I know a bunch of colleagues who swear by it also.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product!!!!  No more carpal tunnel pains!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these so much!!!!!! This is my 4th one ---- I just have that many computers lol! :) They are very durable and last forever. I just wish they sold the balls separately as they snap out of the mouse in order to clean inside there and my son was playing with one of the balls and promptly lost it. I work on the computer per my job and this kind also seems to reduce the possibility of carpal tunnel. I used to be bothered by pain in my wrist with the regular styled mouse but have been using this kind for past 3+ years and that has disappeared now. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jade in the Desert

customer_reviews.title: Will always buy this one
customer_reviews.text: I do genealogy, numerous searches, lots of reading and a tons of copy and paste. So I love how I can sit or lay down and use the mouse without having to actually move it. With the computer sitting in front of me on the table I can sit it on the sofa while Im semi laying or sitting just move the ball and click.Pretty much works great anywhere even camping just sat it on my leg. I use it constantly so really wear it out, this is my 3rd one (The first used a PS/2 port not like the current USB) Now that was a l-o-n-g time ago. No Amazon back then. Perfect for me (I'm in my 60s)
customer_reviews.author: dIANE

customer_reviews.title: Just as good second time round
customer_reviews.text: This mouse can easily be switched between hands, which is a huge advantage if you suffer from intermittent pain in both hands. It makes scrolling and tracking so much easier and more ergonomic when attached to my work laptop and is a great fit for me. Note that I am a woman with small hands so I have to wonder whether it would be suitable for someone with longer fingers or broader hands, as their fingers might not curve naturally around the tracker ball and buttons. It's the second mouse like this that I've bought.
customer_reviews.author: michelisima

customer_reviews.title: The overall height is too much for my hand
customer_reviews.text: My hand and arm are sore trying to keep my hand on top of this trackball. It's just too high so my hand slips off. Also, it won't stay still on my desk, it's sliding around, so it makes it even harder to keep a grip. I miss the scrolling of my touch mouse, also. I have configured it for the secondary button to scroll, but it does not work well and not at all on some websites. Disappointed in the overall quality and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: V. Fitzsimons

customer_reviews.title: but there is no scroll wheel so it's probably not the best mouse for web surfing
customer_reviews.text: I mean it works, but there is no scroll wheel so it's probably not the best mouse for web surfing. This is my fault though for not looking for the scroll when when purchasing. The tracking isn't near as good as either a laser or modern optical gaming mouse either though so your most likely not going to get very precise cursor control with this mouse. All this said it's still probably a good mouse that will last a long time and I generally do like track ball mice.
customer_reviews.author: bbridge

customer_reviews.title: After 10 months of use-- its trash
customer_reviews.text: This is not "ergonomic" it's designed for left or right handed people so that means its not ergonomic for either. My medium sized mens hands cramp up after a few hours with this mouse. The unit does not grip the desk, instead it slips around easily so sometimes two hands are need to drag something onscreen from the far left to the far right-- one hand to hold onto it and the other to move the ball. It needs to be cleaned more often than the previous trackman (with the large ball). I am tossing this away-- I've had enough with this terrible trackman.
customer_reviews.author: Doug.

customer_reviews.title: I don't Game but have used this model for Years!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this trackball. It responds quickly and accurately to touch and movement. I spend up to 12 hours using a computer for work in a day and this mouse makes life much easier for me. It fits my hand and is easy to use. I think it was about 10 years ago I started using this model and have yet to find one that I like nearly as much. I keep a spare so that I don't ever have to wait for delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: The Dream of the '90s is Alive
customer_reviews.text: I had always wanted one of these Logitech trackballs, since the late '90s. Finally got this one. The trackball is everything I remembered from back then: slick, elegant, comfortable. But something happened since '99: scroll wheels. This trackball doesn't have a scroll wheel function, and that is a bit awkward. I wouldn't have minded this in 1999, but in 2020, I need my scroll wheel a lot more. Still a really solid product. Four stars for build quality and feel--but if you need scroll wheel functionality in your life, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: ouij

customer_reviews.title: Great trackball
customer_reviews.text: I like this model of trackball mouse, so I was very pleased to find a replacement that matched the trackball mouse I have been using for about 8 years. Extremely pleased to have found this version. Would do business again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon CustomerVFB

customer_reviews.title: This remains the best trackball mouse available today
customer_reviews.text: This remains the best trackball mouse available today, in my opinion. It may not be for users that scroll constantly, but the ergonomics of this mouse help with carpal tunnel and wrist pain. This is the only mouse I've used for many years it lasts a long time and is SUPER comfortable [you can use your pointer and middle fingers to control the ball - NOT your thumb like other models force you to do]. My only wish is that Logitech would make this specific model cordless, however until they do this is THE best alternative!
customer_reviews.author: honestreview

customer_reviews.title: Love this trackball
customer_reviews.text: Still my favorite mid-range track ball. Sorry, but I like this one better than newer versions. This purchase replaced a an older one that I wound up giving to my Mom as a back-up for her laptop. That left me trackball-less, so I needed another one. This trackball is nearly indestructible. I've used this model on several laptops from Windows XP to Windows 10 without any compatibility issues. Just plug it in and go. Clean the ball by popping it out and wiping it off with a micro cloth or lens cleaner cloth. Couldn't be simpler. Love this trackball.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Ergonomic Tool to Interface Human Body w/ Technology!  Buy one!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely dynamite. 'Been using them for over 20 years, two years after it was released! SAVED MY WRIST AND INDEX FINGER during an exceedingly mouse-intensive project. They do not last for ever, will you? I think I've worn out 3 or 4 in 20 years. For $20 you can't possibly go wrong. If you don't like it you can always send it back for free or give it to another computer worker; they'll love you for ever. Really.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob B

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Trackman Marble
customer_reviews.text: At first I was a bit leery and missed the scroll wheel on the mouse. Loaded some advanced programs but none worked well for scrolling. Took about a week to use keyboard scroll keys and holding the left key and rolling the ball to scroll to get used to it. Now I like it the ball moves smoothly and lightly and the buttons need a light touch. It also reduces wrist movement and helps with hand pain. I like this configuration as opposed to side mounted ball. The price is good too. Better scrolling would get it 5 stars , but can be worked around.
customer_reviews.author: George E.

customer_reviews.title: Absurd click and drag scroll only on Mac
customer_reviews.text: There's no normal scroll option on Mac. You have to press and hold a tiny button and then move the cursor away from this circle thing that pops up and then it continues to scroll until you let go. It's a complex motion, and inpercise. Worst of all it frequently just doesn't work and instead of scrolling you accidentally click. I didn't even consider needing to look for a scrolling feature on a mouse.
customer_reviews.author: GoClick

customer_reviews.title: The item shipped in perfect time. Thanks
customer_reviews.text: I can't give a proper review myself. I've not had much experience with this trackball mouse. I know a lawyer friend who benefits from the design though.. I have this odd habit of leaving my middle finger up while using a common mouse probably the result of being a lefthander using a right-handed set mouse on the left in classes; a forced habit. The trackman didn't seem to help much. I'm keeping it for further investigation when I'm not typing as often. In order not to swing the ratings, I'll give it five stars simply because it has benefited my Lawyer friend with carpal tunnel and trigger finger. The item shipped in perfect time. Thanks, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: GM L`artiste

customer_reviews.title: Trying new mouse for wrist issue
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a few track balls years ago, so decided to give this another try lately as I'm having some problems with my wrists and hand pain. So far so good! I use a wrist support pad when I use this track ball mouse so that makes it easier. So far its working good no complaints. I just use it to do work online no gaming or anything.
customer_reviews.author: ArvadaDude

customer_reviews.title: Keeps freezing
customer_reviews.text: Works great when it works but it keeps on freezing on me, then I have to restart the computer in order to make it work. I love the options, especially the scroll buttons but the freezing is getting to be a problem. It says that system requirements are MacOS 10.5 and higher but the MacOS is only up to 10.14 at this point in time and the software on the Logitech website states 10.11 or higher. I'd hate to have to return this but am not sure what else to do at this point in time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kinkade

customer_reviews.title: Either Hand works.
customer_reviews.text: I was having some problems with my right hand and switched at my doctor's suggestion. I have been enjoying using this mouse with my left hand and now the right is resolved so I can use it with either hand. 4/4/17 I've changed my mind. I loved it at first, but now, after 4 months, it doesn't work at all. Disappointing. I haven't contacted Logitech yet.
customer_reviews.author: kitkat

customer_reviews.title: has the best price in it's category
customer_reviews.text: I Have uses this trackball for almost eight year at work (this is my second one, I bought it for use at my house) and I can say. Pros: It can be extrememely precise, you can ajust how much (... it will require some practice if you put it too sensible), is incredible durable, almost free of maintenance, has the best price in it's category, and of course it si very comfortable. cont: It is pretty big and the people that thing that it is a normal mouse could think that is ugly. I recomend it thoroughly, very good election!!
customer_reviews.author: sergcafe

customer_reviews.title: Total Crap! Counterfeit Item.
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely 100% counterfeit! It’s not a Logitech mouse as advertised & in the picture. The actual mouse didn’t work well & had the word “Logi” crudely printed on top as opposed to the Logitech brand name as in photo. Total crap. Do not buy unless you are an idiot.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice way to avoid carpal tunnel
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this type of mouse for many years. I started to get carpal tunnel from using regular mouse. Started with this and now my carpal tunnel went away for the most part. Don't loose mouse or anything. Using just fingers to move ball and clicking not the whole hand and wrist. I don't game so I cannot answer anything with gaming.
customer_reviews.author: cytherea

customer_reviews.title: Wow, not a fan.
customer_reviews.text: I should have stuck with my gut, this thing is hard to use. I don't like it at all. Ordered a traditional trackball by logitech and its so much better. the only reason I took a chance on this one is because I needed a wired one. Not going to return it because there's nothing wrong with it, but I'm sure not going to use it. Horrible design.
customer_reviews.author: SmokyBlue

customer_reviews.title: It Does What I Want
customer_reviews.text: This has always been my favorite mouse. But even the best wear out eventually. Found this on Amazon. Inexpensive compared to others. Does not have a wheel, but I have a Logitech wireless mouse for that if I need to scroll. You will love this mouse if you love trackballs. If not, then not so much. It really shines in games where it gives me much better control
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only mouse that you won't want to kill with a trap !
customer_reviews.text: Using a mouse is like playing a musical instrument. If you have been pushing a piece of plastic across your desk for a long time, the rolling ball mouse will take a little getting used to. I bought my original Logitech marble mouse from Radio Shack for about $14. But everything was on sale then. $22 for this mouse is a great price and after using this style of mouse, you will wish it came originally with your computer. I wore my original​ out in about six years. A good run for a mechanical device. I definitely recommend this style and brand of mouse by this seller
customer_reviews.author: Steven M.

customer_reviews.title: Not an easy transition from a traditional mouse
customer_reviews.text: It's sleek, but you have to use your right thumb and middle finger for the left and right click respectively. That means you're moving the cursor with your your index finger. Not an easy transition from a traditional mouse. I prefer the track ball on the left of the device. Also, there is no screen scroll capability; so your have to use the mouse on the side scroll bar of the page or document. Inexpensive, so I just tossed it verse return. Not recommended for those who really prefer the traditional mouse interaction.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: My Absolute Standby
customer_reviews.text: I have worn out at least four of these over the years and that isn't easy to do. I need an ambidextrous trackball mouse due to physical issues with my wrists and this is the best, most comfortable and functional for me. I only have two criticisms, so perhaps I should subtract half a star: first a dedicated scroll wheel or ring would be nice. You can program the buttons for scrolling but then you lose other functionality. Second, Logitech needs to make a cordless version of this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bierbaum

customer_reviews.title: Will last forever.
customer_reviews.text: For some strange reason, my boyfriend is obsessed with these mice. This is his third one in 17 years, so I'd say they have a pretty great lifespan! We're both gamers, and while I prefer traditional multi button mice, he likes this specific trackball. Logitech is a great brand in general for durability, and this product lives up to their standard.
customer_reviews.author: Candice K

customer_reviews.title: Now it seems like I have to get one every 2 years
customer_reviews.text: The first two I bought of this lasted many, many years. Now it seems like I have to get one every 2 years, it doesn't seem to be as well made as it used to. It would eventually skip and sometimes double clicks even when you didn't. My husband won't use anything else for gaming but I guess it's the better option than getting the ~$80 one that would likely die at the same rate.
customer_reviews.author: Tester

customer_reviews.title: It lasts about 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased tons of these. No more! They wear out too quick and need replaced. All parts. The rollers, the buttons. Unreal. It will save your wrist from throbbing. If you do competition gaming it would take a purchase of 10 of them to find 1 suitable and then it will only work for 1 major game. I do not do that, just a realistic assessment. Many of these come as 2nds partially defective from the factory.
customer_reviews.author: DJ EQ

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older model that stopped working (I had that one for 5 years). This one works great, and very comfortable. A little less heavy than the older model which I like. Also, the color looks better- the older version was a lighter shade of silver which contrasted too much to my dark grey/black work laptop. This one is darker and more attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley B

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse to avoid tired hands
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using a trackball roller mouse and I am impressed. It is easy to maneuver and has really helped me in reducing hand pain at the end of a busy day. I work in an educational institution where a lot of my workload revolves around data entry and this tool has been a game-changer for me. I highly recommend you trying it if you use a mouse often. I don't need much space since it does not need to be moved around, all the moving is conducted via the rollerball. the shape is perfect for my hand and is very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rojo-Monserrate

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Great for my mother who is not good with a standard mouse. The fact that this unit is stationary helps her feel more comfortable moving the mouse pointer with the ball than moving the mouse around. It works much better for her to click on the correct item and area if she doensn't have to keep the mouse still while trying to click on something.
customer_reviews.author: W. Vlasak

customer_reviews.title: A great basic-use trackball
customer_reviews.text: If you want use your mouse to point, click, and right click, as I do, this is a great trackball. I have never used the programmable buttons, as they seem small and difficult to click. For basic use, however, you will never find better. Only other disadvantage is because the ball sits up promminently, it comes out of the base in your bag or pouch. Once out, it can get scratched and that causes it to get "stuck" during normal use. My solution has been to get a new one every couple of years - they are rather inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cool

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much, I bought another one for work.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I have used this particular kind of mouse. The first was bought for me by my former job after I broke up arm and my range of motion was limited. I liked it so much I bought one for home. I just bought my newest one for my new job at a new company because I actually missed having the trackball mouse. This mouse just fits my hand nicely and helps with some residual issues I have from that arm I broke so many years ago.
customer_reviews.author: OkieGirl

customer_reviews.title: Had to get used to it
customer_reviews.text: I've had a wireless trackball that used the thumb for the trackball. I wanted to change to a wired version and didn't see a thumb version so decided to try this one. It took a little time to get used to it, but if is your first time using a trackball you'll probably have to problem. At any rate, it's way better than a mouse!
customer_reviews.author: AnnieH

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Trackman Marble Mouse, Four-Button,...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup plug into USB port and away you go. Very responsive with no wander and very easy to use. The only reason not given 5 stars is the following reasons. 1- My first one suddenly quit working for no reason with gentle use. 2- 2nd one began failing intermittently and sometimes would come back on its own but usually required a reboot. I am now on my 3rd unit and hope this is the charm. As you can see reliability is suspect.
customer_reviews.author: Leland L. Bottomley

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to use, works for Mac or PC
customer_reviews.text: I've used several of these with my work PC over the years, and they're fabulous. When my old Macally trackball started double-clicking for every click, I decided to replace it with a Logitech Trackman Marble. I was a little concerned that it wouldn't work as well with my home setup (MacBook Pro and USB hub), but it is great!
customer_reviews.author: N. Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Just couldn't get this to work
customer_reviews.text: No software was supplied the the driver downloaded from Logitech couldn't find this although my Windows 10 computer could. I was having shoulder problems from using my old mouse and hoped using the different muscles a trackball requires would help. Loved the Logitech thumbball but that produced thumb problems. I had high hopes for this but just found it cumbersome and non-responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Ronke

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Hand From Cramping
customer_reviews.text: This is not a medical review but, really, my hand used to cramp up on an almost daily basis using a mouse. I switched to the Trackman Marble and I haven't cramped in decades. Decades. Works right out of the box. Is intuitive to use, durable, and I find it very comfortable. For me it's a winner.
customer_reviews.author: IlPrimitivo

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my old one crapped out after 6+ years, cable/plug issue. Only bad thing is no scroll wheel (at least on the old drivers). These guys are built to last and are real comfortable, at least for me it tends to be more precise than a mouse. Less wear and wear on the wrist and hand because of the design.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Solid Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased several of these for my business. Where trackballs are concerned, these work well without breaking the bank. They don’t break easily, they don’t mind a little dust, and it functions exactly how you hope it would. Bonus: If you want your staff to stay off your computer, this will keep people away that have never used one!
customer_reviews.author: M. Hagler

customer_reviews.title: Works but not great
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has that bigger ball (somewhat similar to the kensington ones). However, it's not as ergonomic as I was hoping and it doesn't really have a nice way to do scrolling (like a scroll wheel which it lacks). I actually like the Logitech M570 better than this one. This is now just my backup one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ball has to be cleaned some times
customer_reviews.text: I had to get use to the mouse remaining still and rolling the ball around, easy enough. What I don't like is not being able to scroll up or down a page. I have to move the mouse all the way over to the right of the screen and grab that pain slider. S, for me, it hasn't helped with my OA or carpal tunnel. It's also harder playing my Mahjong games. It does work well and if you don't have all the pain and lack of mobility then this would be perfect for you. I think I'll look for a regular corded mouse - which are getting hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: Debbee

customer_reviews.title: Useful for All Purposes
customer_reviews.text: High quality item, arrived in standard Amazon packaging. Inside was the trackball mouse inside of the Logitech packaging. I use this mouse for video and audio editing as well as casual gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent price.  Good alternative to regular mice in certain situations.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to get used to and is a good alternative to a mouse when you do not have space to move a mouse around. Also synaptic pads on laptops are very irritating so I use of these when using a laptop. I never found a synaptic pad that was worth it.... they respond without actually touching the pad.... garbage stuff. Use a trackball instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mr-Darcy

customer_reviews.title: USE WINDOWS 10 SETTINGS-NO MANUFACTURER SETTINGS HELP
customer_reviews.text: This is the only trackball mouse I could find for left handed. I used Windows 10 'Settings' to adjust the pointer and to interchange the buttons because I could not find settings for this mouse of the Logitech website. After using a wheeled right handed trackball I found scrolling very inconvenient with this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a previous model that I had for 15 years before the cord started getting frayed. Honestly, it's the best mouse in the world. I have arthritis issues in my hands and wrist and this is so much better for me than using a standard mouse. It works perfectly with my Macbook. I just plugged it in and it was ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Needs a better scroll mechanism.
customer_reviews.text: After installing the driver, to have a proper scrolling, you'll have to set both control buttons to autoscroll and Universal Scroll respectively to activate the scroll because you'll have to alter it per application. One works in browser, the othe one in windows, you can't be sure which works in which and in some applications both don't work at all. I had kensington orbit which had an incredible scroll ring that works with everything. If Logitech won't update the driver software soon it's wiser to buy kensington
customer_reviews.author: Erhan Akdeniz

customer_reviews.title: I've owned Logitech Trackman Marble Trackballs for many years. They are the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Logitech Trackman Marble Trackball Mouse I have owned. My current one is fine but I ordered another one just in case the supply disappears. I don't think Logitech manufacturers this model any longer. That is too bad because their new M570 Laser Wireless Trackball Mouse really isn't as good as the older model and costs twice as much. The problem with the M570 is that you control the ball with your thumb. With mine, I control the ball with my forefinger and middle fingertips. Much better control using two fingers rather then your thumb. The M570 I purchased is now listed on eBay.
customer_reviews.author: awebbiz

customer_reviews.title: Useless without the additional software because it lacks scroll.
customer_reviews.text: I have several other Trackmen. both those you control with you index and those with the thumb. This is by far the worse of the bunch, mainly because there is not scroll wheel. Only if you download the additional software that you can use the buttons to map to scroll up/down, but then with the additional software I was really unhappy with the movement settings as compared to the default implementation of my Macbook, plus since I use the other Trackmen when at home, I change the sensitivity often, something which is even less comfortable with the additional software. Sadly this is not even close to the old Cordless Optical Trackman.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sheinker

product_meta.title: Logitech Trackman Marble Trackball Mouse – Wired USB Ergonomic Mouse for Computers, with 4 Programmable Buttons, Dark Gray
product_meta.description:
Left handed? Right handed? When you're working on your computer day and night, and you want more flexibility, the Logitech® Trackman® Marble® will help increase your comfort level.

Ambidextrous trackball design
A trackball design with a long, broad palm area and gentle curves keeps your hand comfortable and supported all day-whether you use your right or left hand.

Stable base
Your hand stays comfortable all day long with this stay-put design. Plus, it saves you space.

Convenient button controls
Buttons let you easily move forward and backward when you're surfing the Web.

Fingertip-based control
You’ll enjoy fast, accurate cursor movement with just a move of your finger.

Marble® optical technology
Our patented technology gives you smooth tracking on almost any surface so you can be productive wherever you work.*

* Does not work on clear glass or mirrors
feature_bullets: TRACKBALL COMFORT - Sculpted ambidexterous shape supports your right or left hand and stays in one place—move the cursor without moving your arm
CONVENIENT CONTROLS - Moving quickly between documents or browsing your favorite Web sites is a breeze with large, easy-to-reach Back/Forward buttons
ZERO SETUP REQUIRED - Flexible wired connectivity means you just plug the cable into your USB or PS/2 port - it works right out of the box.
PROGRAMMABLE CONTROLS - Configure the buttons to do exactly what you want like switching applications, opening browser windows or jump to full screen while watching videos

BUILT BY LOGITECH - This mouse comes with the quality and design we’ve built into more than a billion mice, more than any other manufacturer. System Requirements: Windows Vista Windows 7 Windows 8 Windows 10|USB port|CD-ROM drive|Mac OS X 10.4 or later
